results.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

results.title_for_label: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.description: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.
description_for_label: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. results.title: A Trip to the moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Milan Herzog and William Peltz
results.brief_description: An imaginary rocket takes off to the moon and explores its surface. Describes conditions met in navigation to the moon. Once above the moon’s surface, shows in detail the craters and “seas”, the valleys and mountains that can be seen from the earth.

results.title: A Trip to Mexico: an integrated approach
results.creator_credit: Lily Steiner, Jeff Spencer and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
An enthusiastic approach to integrated curriculum at Southvale Primary School. A program full of ideas where the subject areas are integrated into a complex unit of work based on a trip to China and Mexico.

results.title: A Trip to Mars
results.creator_credit: Edison Manufacturing Company and Ashley Miller
results.brief_description: By mixing two power-like substances, a scientist discovers the source of reverse gravity. When he tries this concoction on himself, he is elevated to the planet Mars. This Edison Manufacturing Company production is reported to be the first science-fiction film produced in the United States.

results.title: A Trip from Chicago
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”
Discusses ideas for advanced forms of public transport over varying distances of hundreds or thousands of miles. High-speed ground vehicles using rocket power and roller bearings, sealed tubes or air-cushion support, vertical takeoff aircraft, jets and rockets are discussed with their designers and prototypes are demonstrated. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: A Trip down the river = Rejs [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zespol Tor, Zespoly Filmowe and Marek Piwowski
results.brief_description: This unassuming satire begins with a pair of young Polish men trying to get on board a luxuriant riverboat without tickets. They disguise themselves as members of the ship’s personnel and are eventually let on board. At a group meeting with all in attendance, one of these stowaways, Kaowiec (Stanislaw Tym) is, to his surprise, introduced as the ship’s organiser of cultural and social activities. The passengers then give their opinion on everything from leisure activities to the question of giving opinions at all and a committee is formed to plan a group party. From this moment on, “A Trip Down the River” becomes a clear satire on processes of decision-making, structures of power, committee meetings and group dynamics. The main characters are a mixed bag, each with their own hilarious idiosyncrasies and quirks. Those passengers who comprise the party-committee represent a cross-section of Polish society - the rationalist, the artist, the philosopher, the pragmatist and so on - and so when each expresses their views, the film becomes a meta-narrative on various approaches to life and meaning. Acclaimed a cult film in post-war Poland, “A Trip Down the River” is a wry comedy that plays it straight all the way. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: A Trip down memory lane
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Arthur Lipsett and Donald Brittain
results.brief_description: Arthur Lipsett’s incisive look at human might, majesty and mayhem, compiled from some peculiar newsreel items of the twentieth century. The filmmaker calls this ‘additional material for a time capsule’, but his arrangement of pictures combined with Ron Alexander’s soundtrack makes it almost explosive. There are hundreds of items, once front-page news, but all wryly grotesque when seen in this reshuffle of the past. (Awards: San Francisco, Venice)

results.title: A Tribute to the Wild West: Proud Rebel / Kansas Pacific
results.creator_credit: Alliance Pictures, Walter Wanger, Samuel Goldwyn Jnr, Michael Curtiz and Ray Nazarro
results.brief_description: Proud Rebel: Alan Ladd is the proud rebel in this taut suspenseful drama. Searching for a doctor to cure his mute son, he settles in a sheep ranching town to raise money for the operation. The warmth of love, the beauty of the country and the violence of the greedy men combine to make this one of the most dramatic and emotional Westerns in film history. “Kansas Pacific”: Hayden is the army engineer sent to speed up the work on completion of the Kansas Pacific Railroad which is being slowed down by confederate sympathisers, just prior to the break out of the Civil War.
